addressleaf.section:
To the right honorable my very singular good Lord
e L. Burghley Lord highe Treasuro
r
of England.

xj fe
b
1590
. M
r
Bodeleie to my L./

page.lettertext:
fol.159r
May it please yo
r
good L. After I had written
and sent away my for mer, of
e 9 of this moneth,
this letter of
e
states
was brought unto me by
their
Greffier:
whiche is their answear to her
Ma
ties
letter of
e 21 of De
c
and to my Propo-
sic
o
n upon it. Because I have written of those
affaires already, at sufficient length, and like-
wise of
e rest, that was committed to
S
r
John Norreis,
I have nothing by this bearer to advertise further,
but that we have intelligence from divers quarters,
that
e
Empero
rs
Ambassado
rs
are at
Andwerp,
and will send hither for a Passeport, to come to
a Treatie w
t
e states. There is
also advertisment given, that
e Spaniardes are
mutined in
e Lande of
Liege,
for want of pay:
w
ch
will be some stoppe to
e Enemies attemptes:
especially if it prove, as we are also informed,
that in sundrie other places they are bent to
doe
e like.
And thus for this p
nt
I take my
humble leave. From
e Hage. Fe
b
11. 90.
Yo
r
L. most humbly bounden. Tho. Bodley
